_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Dorman Brothers, L.L.C.-Hugo Plant

For further information regarding this plan, please contact:
Michael B. Dorman
19230 County Road 55
Burlington, Colorado  80807
719/346-7970

1.  The Facility Policy
The owners, members, and employees of Dorman Brothers L.L.C. are committed to the prevention of accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and other agencies to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2.  Facility Information
This facility switched ownership on June 17, 2004 and the most current safety measures were in implemented at that time.  The primary activity at this facility is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application.  The ammonia is delivered in by truck.

3.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program
This facility has implemented the provisions of Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia K-61-1, published by the American Natioanl Standards Institute, Inc. and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration, 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.

4.  The Five Year Accicent History
This facility was put into business on June 17, 2004 and there has been no accidental realease of anhydrous ammonia that have caused any deaths, injuries or caused significant property damage at this facility, or any offsite consequesnces of a release.

5.  The Emeregency Action Plan
The Facility has:
-A written Emergency Action Plan
-It will provide SARA Title III information to the state and local authoriites.
-Done employee training

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Safety improvements will be an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic inspections are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific
anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.
